title: Samsung Galaxy S24 256GB gets massive price drop on Flipkart, Amazon during Republic Day sale - India TV News
summary:
Samsung Galaxy S24 256GB gets massive price drop on Flipkart, Amazon during Republic Day sale

Publication Date: January 2025   Source: India TV News

The Republic Day Sale events on major e-commerce platforms like Flipkart and Amazon have led to significant discounts on the Samsung Galaxy S24, making it a great time for smartphone buyers.

  • The Samsung Galaxy S24 5G was launched at approximately Rs 80,000 but is now available for much less.
  • On Amazon, the device is listed at Rs 79,999 with a 30% discount, available for Rs 50,999 during the sale.
  • Amazon also offers cashback and trade-in options to customers.
  • Flipkart lists the same device at Rs 79,999, offering a 28% discount, bringing the price down to Rs 57,298.
  • Flipkart offers additional cashbacks for certain payment methods.
“Now is a prime opportunity to make a purchase.”

This sale offers a considerable price reduction on a premium device, coinciding with the upcoming launch of the Samsung Galaxy S25 series, making it an attractive option for potential buyers.
newTitle: Samsung Galaxy S24 Price Cut During Republic Day Sale

title: DJI Flip drone, a lightweight vlog camera, launched in India: Price, features and more | Mint - Mint
summary:
DJI Flip drone, a lightweight vlog camera, launched in India: Price, features and more

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

The DJI Flip is a new lightweight and versatile vlog camera drone that combines the best features of the DJI Neo and DJI Mini for powerful aerial photography.

Key Features:

  • Foldable propeller guards made from lightweight carbon fiber for enhanced durability.
  • Automatic braking system and 3D Infrared Sensing for secure flying in low-light conditions.
  • 1/1.3-inch CMOS sensor for capturing 48MP stills and 4K HDR videos at 60fps.
  • Supports slow-motion recording at 100fps and offers a 4:3 aspect ratio sensor for vertical shots.
  • Six intelligent shooting modes including Dronie, Circle, Rocket, Spotlight, Helix, and Boomerang.
  • Available in multiple configurations with prices starting at ₹37,927.

Availability and Pricing:
The DJI Flip is available in India, priced at ₹37,927 for the base model, ₹55,203 for the model with the DJI RC 2 controller, and ₹67,299 for the Fly More Combo. Shipping has already commenced through DJI’s official channels.
newTitle: DJI Launches Lightweight Flip Drone: Features, Pricing, and Availability

title: Apps Set To Give Way To Assistants: How ChatGPT, Google Gemini, Meta AI May Reshape Our Digital Lives - NDTV Profit
summary:
Apps Set To Give Way To Assistants: How ChatGPT, Google Gemini, Meta AI May Reshape Our Digital Lives

Date: 15 Jan 2025 Source: NDTV Profit Tech

The article discusses the anticipated shift from mobile apps to AI assistants like ChatGPT, Google Gemini, and Meta AI. This change is predicted to reshape how users engage with technology.

  • By 2027, mobile app usage may fall by 25% due to reliance on AI assistants.
  • Brands with low app engagement will be most affected.
  • Over one-third of web content will cater to generative AI-powered searches by 2026.
  • Marketing strategies will adapt with a shift toward subscription-based platforms.
“By 2026, over one-third of web content will be created for the purposes of gen AI-powered search.”

This trend highlights a fundamental transformation in digital interactions, pushing brands to reevaluate their marketing and engagement strategies in light of AI advancements.
newTitle: How AI Assistants are Transforming Digital Ecosystems

title: Honor’s Magic 7 Pro looks flagship through and through - The Verge
Android co-founder on Microsoft’s $400 billion loss — 'Sorry Bill, that’s on you' - CNBCTV18
summary:
Android Co-Founder Blames Bill Gates for Microsoft's $400 Billion Loss

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

In a recent interview, Bill Gates acknowledged Microsoft's failure to compete in the smartphone market, attributing it to poor management. Android's co-founder, Rich Miner, criticized Gates, claiming that the loss of $400 billion is primarily his fault.

  • Rich Miner reflects on how he helped create Android to provide an alternative to Microsoft's control over mobile.
  • Bill Gates admitted that Microsoft missed vital opportunities during an interview, calling it “the greatest mistake of all time.”
  • The delay in launch and reliance on the PC strategy hampered Microsoft's ability to compete with Apple and Android.
  • Microsoft's acquisition of Nokia failed to revive its mobile strategy, resulting in significant layoffs and an eventual exit from the smartphone market.

“Sorry Bill, you're more responsible for losing the $400B than you realize.”
— Rich Miner (@richminer)

The events serve as a stark reminder of the importance of adapting to technological shifts, a lesson that has cost Microsoft dearly.
newTitle: Android Co-Founder Blames Bill Gates for Microsoft's $400 Billion Loss

title: Samsung Galaxy Ring Gets Two New Size Options, More Health Features With New Update - News18
summary:
Samsung Galaxy Ring Gets Two New Size Options, More Health Features With New Update

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: News18

The Samsung Galaxy Ring is now available in more sizes and offers enhanced health tracking features with a recent update, making it accessible for a wider audience.

  • The Galaxy Ring now comes in 11 sizes, catering to users with larger hands.
  • Price in India starts at Rs 38,999, with a battery life of one week.
  • The ring tracks sleep, heart rate, and fitness metrics, with built-in storage and an IP68 water resistance rating.
  • New health features include analysis of sleep patterns based on room temperature and air quality.
  • The device can be paired with non-Galaxy Android phones, though features are limited compared to Galaxy devices.
"The Galaxy Ring will analyze your sleep patterns and recommend a routine to suit your habits."

This update enhances the usability and functionality of the Samsung Galaxy Ring, broadening its appeal and offering new health monitoring capabilities.
newTitle: Samsung Galaxy Ring Gets New Sizes and Health Features

summary:
Rich Miner Blames Bill Gates for Microsoft's Smartphone Failure

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Financial Express

Rich Miner, co-founder of Android, attributes Microsoft's smartphone market failures to Bill Gates, stating it cost the company approximately $400 billion in market value.

  • Miner claims Gates' monopolistic approach stifled innovation in mobile devices.
  • He insists that Android was created to counter Microsoft's dominance in the mobile sector.
  • Gates acknowledges his mismanagement as a significant mistake for Microsoft.
  • The article discusses Microsoft's missed opportunities to adopt a more open and flexible approach in the mobile market.
“The greatest mistake of all time is the mismanagement I engaged in that caused Microsoft not to be what Android is.” - Bill Gates

This discussion highlights the importance of adaptability and innovation in the tech industry, reflecting on how major companies can miss pivotal shifts in market trends.
newTitle: Rich Miner Blames Bill Gates for Microsoft's Smartphone Failure

title: Motorola Razr 60 Ultra may be India's first foldable launch of 2025: Report - Business Standard
summary:
Motorola Razr 60 Ultra may be India's first foldable launch of 2025: Report

Last Updated: Jan 15 2025 | Source: Business Standard

Motorola is set to launch its next-generation flip-style foldable smartphone, the Motorola Razr 60 Ultra, in India soon. The device has received its Bureau of Indian Standards certification, indicating an early launch.

  • The Razr 60 Ultra is linked to the model number XT2551 and is expected to be a successor to the Razr 50 Ultra.
  • It could be powered by the new Qualcomm Snapdragon 8s Elite System-on-Chip.
  • Previous model, Razr 50 Ultra, was certified in April 2024, with a launch in July.
  • Specifications of Razr 50 Ultra include a 6.9-inch main display, Qualcomm Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 processor, and a 4000mAh battery.
“The BIS certification indicates that Motorola may be gearing up for an earlier-than-expected launch.”

This launch could mark a significant addition to Motorola's foldable offering in India, following their previous models. Users can look forward to improved features and specifications.
newTitle: Motorola Razr 60 Ultra may be India's first foldable launch of 2025: Report

title: OnePlus 13 vs iQOO 13: Which Snapdragon 8 Elite-powered phone should you buy? - The Indian Express
summary:
OnePlus 13 vs iQOO 13: Which Snapdragon 8 Elite-powered phone should you buy?

Published on: [Insert date] Source: Indian Express

The OnePlus 13 and iQOO 13 are top contenders in the high-performance smartphone market powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite chip, with a notable price difference of ₹10,000.

  • Display: The iQOO 13 features a flat 144Hz display, while the OnePlus 13 offers a curved 120Hz version.
  • Camera: Both smartphones have triple 50 MP cameras, but the OnePlus includes Hasselblad tuning and a superior telephoto lens.
  • Software: OnePlus 13 runs OxygenOS 15 providing a smoother experience compared to iQOO’s FunTouchOS 13.
  • Charging: iQOO offers faster 120W charging, but OnePlus provides versatile charging options including wireless.
  • Price: iQOO 13 starts at ₹59,999 versus ₹69,999 for OnePlus 13, offering larger storage options.
“We hope this comparison helps you choose the right Snapdragon 8 Elite-powered phone that suits your needs!”

In conclusion, while the iQOO 13 is more affordable, the OnePlus 13 offers features that may justify its higher price for certain users.
newTitle: OnePlus 13 vs iQOO 13: Which Snapdragon 8 Elite-powered phone should you buy?

OnePlus 13 receives more features in first software update: What is new - Business Standard
summary:
OnePlus 13 receives more features in first software update: What is new

Publication Date: Jan 15 2025 | Source: Business Standard

The first major software update for the OnePlus 13 enhances camera performance and introduces charging status to Live Alerts. This update includes significant improvements and new features for users.

  • Software version: CPH2649 15.0.0.402(EX01)
  • Update size: 988MB

Key Points

  • Communication: New Touch to share feature for iOS, optimized IPv6 connectivity, improved Bluetooth and network stability.
  • Camera: Enhanced watermark options, improved clarity in Portrait and Photo modes, 4K video improvement, and fixes for photo brightness and color accuracy.
  • Audio: Improved audio quality.
  • System: Charging status added to Live Alerts, better system stability, and integrated December 2024 Android security patch.
  • Apps: Added AI features to Google Messages, new weather widget, and improvements to various widgets.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“OnePlus has rolled out the first major update to the newly launched OnePlus 13 smartphone.”

Conclusion

This update not only enhances the OnePlus 13's performance but also adds features that improve user experience significantly.
newTitle: OnePlus 13 Receives First Software Update with New Features

title: OpenAI unveils ‘Tasks’ feature for ChatGPT to enable scheduling and automation: How it works | Mint - Mint
summary:
OpenAI Introduces 'Tasks' Feature for Enhanced Scheduling and Automation in ChatGPT

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

OpenAI has announced a new beta feature for ChatGPT called Tasks, designed to improve user experience through scheduling and automation.

  • The Tasks feature allows users to set reminders or schedule actions in ChatGPT.
  • Currently available for paid subscribers, with plans to extend access to free users by year-end.
  • Users can access Tasks through the profile menu or by typing commands naturally into the chat.
  • Tasks support one-time and recurring reminders, including sending scheduled updates or motivational messages.
  • This feature enhances the chatbot's functionalities by allowing it to perform tasks at specified times.
“Today we’re rolling out a beta version of tasks—a new way to ask ChatGPT to do things for you at a future time.” — OpenAI

The feature is currently limited to the platform and does not integrate with external applications. Feedback from the beta phase will be used to refine functionality for a wider release.
newTitle: OpenAI Introduces 'Tasks' Feature for Enhanced Scheduling and Automation in ChatGPT

title: Google's search engine market share falls below 90% for first time since 2015: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Google's Search Engine Market Share Falls Below 90% for First Time Since 2015

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Google's global search engine market share has fallen below 90% for the first time since 2015, with recent data indicating a decline in its dominance in the search engine market.

  • In October 2024, Google's market share was 89.34%, followed by 89.99% in November and 89.73% in December.
  • The drop observed is particularly notable in Asia, although trends remain consistent in other regions.
  • In the US, Google's market share peaked at 90.37% in November but dropped to 87.39% in December.
  • Other search engines like Bing, Yandex, and Yahoo have gained some of Google's lost share, with Bing occupying the second position.
  • This shift may be influenced by the emergence of AI-based search applications.
The last time Google's market share fell below 90% was in March 2015 when it stood at 89.52%.

The article highlights a significant turning point for Google, which has held a dominant market position for nearly a decade.
newTitle: Google's Search Engine Market Share Falls Below 90% for First Time Since 2015

title: Motorola Razr 60 Ultra could be launching in India soon, listed on BIS - CNBCTV18
summary:

Publication Date: Jan 15, 2025 2:59 PM IST

Source: CNBC TV18

Motorola is preparing to launch its next flagship foldable phone, the Motorola Razr 60 Ultra, potentially in the second half of 2025. The device has appeared on the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) website.

  • The Razr 60 Ultra is rumored to be powered by the Snapdragon 8s Elite chipset, which has not been officially released globally.
  • The device is listed under model number XT2551, aligning with Motorola's naming conventions.
  • The Razr 50 Ultra provides insights into the expected features, with impressive specs such as a 6.9-inch full-HD+ LTPO pOLED display and a 50MP dual camera setup.
  • Pricing for the Razr 60 Ultra is expected to be similar to its predecessor, which launched at ₹99,999.
“The foldable is listed on BIS under the model number XT2551, with the codename 'Orion.'”

This new device is highly anticipated, and its launch could enhance Motorola's presence in the foldable smartphone market.
newTitle: Motorola Razr 60 Ultra set to launch in India soon with new features

summary:

WhatsApp is launching an update for 2025 that includes a variety of new features to improve the chat experience and user engagement.

  • Selfie Stickers: Users can now turn selfies into stickers available on Android, with iOS availability coming soon.
